sections.title: For China–UK corporate leaders

sections.title: What coaching is (and isn’t)
intro: Example-led conversations keep decisions grounded before we layer on more structure.

leftCard.title: What coaching is
bullets: Example-led conversations keep decisions grounded before we layer on more structure.
Weekly rhythm with small experiments between sessions.
Try free tools first and keep what genuinely helps.

rightCard.title: What coaching isn’t
bullets: Coaching, not therapy—we will signpost therapy when that is safer for you.
We start and end on time so you can plan around sessions with confidence.
You set the pace; we provide structure and accountability without pressure.

sections.title: A calm structure for reflective work
intro: We stay example-first while moving into agreements, cadence, and review points.

steps.title: Step 1 – Initial conversation
steps.description: A 20-minute chat to understand what is changing and share the boundaries we work within.

steps.title: Step 2 – Goal setting
steps.description: We agree the focus, cadence, and accessibility needs before sessions begin.

steps.title: Step 3 – Regular sessions
steps.description: Online conversations (60–75 minutes) with experiments and reflections between sessions.

steps.title: Step 4 – Sustainable growth
steps.description: We pause, review, and keep what works so progress feels steady and kind.

cards.title: Relocating to the UK

cards.title: Balancing visas and identity

cards.title: Catching burnout early
summary: You notice signals of exhaustion and want experiments that protect energy before things fracture.

sections.title: Coaching pathways shaped with you
intro: Each pathway is a starting point. We adapt pace, language, and focus once we understand your reality.

cards.title: For mid-career returners
summary: Rebuild momentum after a break without pretending the last chapter did not happen.
Clarify what you learned, how it shapes your work now, and how you choose to share it.

cards.title: For newcomers to the UK

Map options, boundaries, and risks so your choices honour visas, values, and energy.

cards.title: For young professionals

left.title: Try a simple self-reflection tool
description: Curated bilingual resources to support your experiments between sessions.
No email gate, no pressure—just invitations to pause and notice.

items.title: Values Map
items.summary: Map what truly matters to you and check how your current choices align with your core values.

items.title: Self-talk Reframe Cards
items.summary: Gentle prompts to help you notice harsh self-talk and reframe it with more compassionate language.

items.title: Behaviour Experiment Ladder
items.summary: Plan small, low-risk experiments to test new behaviours instead of all-or-nothing change.

right.title: Read a short article
description: These short reads help you pause, notice patterns, and experiment gently between sessions.
They invite reflection and learning – they are not medical, legal, financial or immigration advice.

items.title: A kinder way to restart
items.summary: When you’re stuck, smaller and gentler beats louder and bigger. Momentum returns when actions fit your current capacity.

sections.title: Agreements that protect pace and safety
intro: These agreements protect pace, wellbeing, and confidentiality.

faqs.question: Is this coaching or therapy?
faqs.answer: Coaching, not therapy—we will signpost therapy when that is safer for you.

faqs.question: What are our time expectations?
faqs.answer: We start and end on time so you can plan around sessions with confidence.

faqs.question: How do you handle notes and data?
faqs.answer: We keep minimal notes and delete them on request within agreed retention windows.

faqs.question: Who sets the pace?
faqs.answer: You set the pace; we provide structure and accountability without pressure.

sections.title: Questions about how coaching works?
body: Read about session rhythms, pricing, ethics, and how we tailor support for individuals and organisations.

sections.title: If you would like to talk things through
body: Share a few lines about what is changing. We respond with clarity and respect your pace.
You can share as much or as little as you like; we usually reply within three UK working days.
